title: Error: Your plugin must have an id
author: zayn-m

comments.body: When using the React components, you should _not_ also do `uppy.use(Dashboard)`. The `<Dashboard />` component does that for you. Instead, pass your Dashboard plugin options as props in the `<Dashboard />` component.

title: when using the dashboard and OnbeforeUpload, I click on send, it sends, but the behavior is not as expected. Length undefined error
author: guimaraesSalgado

comments.body:
The Dashboard uses a file's `meta.name` for rendering. This line is probably overwriting `meta` so that the file name is not there anymore:
```js
          meta: files[fileID] = this.anexoMetadata,
```
(Also, that `files[fileID]` assignment seems wrong 😄 )

This should work instead:
```js
meta: {
  ...files[fileID],
  ...this.anexoMetadata
}
```

title: Preact resolution error with Parcel [solution: clear parcel cache]
body:
Parcel since upgrading to 1.0.1 from 1.0.0 causes the following issue when compiling:

```
/node_modules/preact/dist/preact.mjs: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open /node_modules/preact/dist/preact.mjs'
```

So it appears a fix to help webpack has broken another bundler
author: wroughtec

comments.body: oh my! I think this might be a cache issue, can you try removing the `.cache` directory in your project folder and restarting parcel?
